Today, Blake‚Äôs son Simon is a freshman in high school. The town of Shelby, NE dedicated a veterans‚Äô memorial to Blake so his spirit can live on.
His rural Nebraska community and the entire state were shocked. They all turned out for the funeral, as did the freedom riders from throughout Nebraska.
On July 29, 2003, Black was killed in an accident involving his convoy and a local vehicle. He was the first casualty of a deployed Nebraska Army National Guard Member in over a decade. #Sacrifice
In Bosnia, Blake was always ready to serve and he connected well with the local population. Unit chaplains needed his help and he became a Eucharistic Minister who actively supported chapel programs.

Christina and Blake were married on September 7, 2002, just as the National Guard 1-167th Cavalry was preparing to deploy to Bosnia. Right before Blake was deployed the couple found out they were expecting.
He returned home in September 2001, just as life in the United States was changing forever following the 9/11 terrorist attacks.
Before graduating from high school, he asked his girlfriend Christina to marry him before going to @FortKnockKY for advanced training that included Ranger training.
Blake saw joining @NENationalGuard as an opportunity to spread his wings and go to college using the Guard‚Äôs tuition assistance program.
Blake knew everyone around town and everyone knew him. He was always happy and eager to help someone solve a problem. #LoveNE
.@NENationalGuard Specialist Blake Kelly was born and raised in Shelby, NE. He was a typical small-town Nebraska boy- his early life was filled football, track, and band.
